alert.note: Alert for Buchanan (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 4:13PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and southern West Virginia, including the following counties, in southwest Virginia, Buchanan. In southern West Virginia, McDowell. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, larger creeks and streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 PM EDT, Between 1.5 and 3 inches of rain fell earlier today. This has caused larger creeks and streams and rivers to rapidly rise. Some larger creeks and streams will continue to rise late this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Welch, Gary, War, Northfork, Davy, Bradshaw, Keystone, Anawalt, Kimball, Coalwood, Cucumber, Jolo, Avondale, Elbert, Jenkinjones, Stacy, Oakwood, Maybeury and Vansant. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
